title: Integrating Domain Knowledge into Large Language Models for Enhanced Fashion Recommendations
author: Zhan Shi (Santa Clara University), Shanglin Yang (Santa Clara University), ...
relevance_why: The integration of large language models for dynamic recommendations may inspire similar methodologies in audio captioning or generative audio tasks, particularly in adapting to user preferences.
background: Utilizing models that leverage vast amounts of linguistic data to provide personalized fashion recommendations, while dynamically adapting to individual preferences through advanced training and retrieval methods.
contribution: This paper introduces a Fashion Large Language Model (FLLM) to solve the limitation of traditional supervised learning methods in fashion recommendations, achieving improved accuracy and adaptability in generating recommendations.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional fashion recommendation systems rely heavily on fixed datasets and supervised learning, often failing to adapt to new styles or user preferences.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by employing retrieval-augmented generation and auto-prompt strategies, allowing the model to dynamically adjust recommendations based on individual user inputs and current fashion trends.

key_innovation: The combination of auto-prompt generation and retrieval augmentation in a large language model to enhance the personalization and relevance of fashion recommendations.
real_world_impact: This approach can potentially revolutionize personalized fashion retail by dynamically adjusting recommendations based on real-time data and user preferences, improving customer experience and engagement.

new_terms.retrieval-augmented generation: **Retrieval-augmented generation** is a technique that enhances generative models by incorporating external retrieval mechanisms to access relevant information, improving the quality and specificity of generated outputs.
